JAMES BLUNT - ALL THE LOST SOULS, album to be released UK September 17th 2007.
Encoded 320Kbps [Lame] mp3. Covers included.

James Blunt [born James Hillier Blount, February 22nd 1974 in Tidworth, Wiltshire] is an English singer-songwriter whose debut album, &#039;Back to Bedlam&#039;, and single releases, especially the number one hit &#039;You&#039;re Beautiful&#039;, brought him to fame in 2005. His style is a mix of pop rock and acoustic rock. Along with vocals, James Blunt plays a wide variety of instruments including the piano, guitar, organ, marimba, and mellotron. He is signed to Linda Perry&#039;s American label Custard, and became the first British artist to top the American singles chart in nearly a decade when his song &#039;You&#039;re Beautiful&#039; reached number one on the Billboard Hot 100 in 2006. 

&#039;All The Lost Souls&#039; is the second studio album from singer-songwriter phenomenon James Blunt. A winning mixture of 70&#039;s influenced pop and acoustic rock, the album is sure to appeal to fans of artists such as Carly Simon and James Taylor. It includes the single &#039;1973&#039;. The music video for the single &#039;1973&#039;, in which a modern-day Blunt strolls among &#039;70s street scenes, reflects the song&#039;s nostalgic tone. It was shot in Los Angeles.
